attributes.action: trigger a referendum in Wales either to ratify or to repeal the Government of Wales Act 2006, which currently has no popular mandate.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Although voted for by only 50.3% of the 50.1% of the Welsh electorate who turned out in the 1997 referendum, the National Assembly has now been elevated to the status of a Government.  In addition, the Government of Wales Act 2006 was placed on the Statute Book despite the fact that the specific details were not presented to the people of Wales at the General Election in 2005. 

We in True Wales call for an early referendum, either to ratify or to repeal the Act so that the Welsh people can be allowed to influence their own constitutional future in an open and democratic manner, rather than having their destiny decided by the political elite.

rejection.details: This is a devolved matter and should be directed to the Scottish Executive / Welsh Assembly / Northern Ireland Executive as appropriate.
reasons: Outside the remit of the Prime Minister and Government
